intro: Melandrium terminale, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and features hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with five petals that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. Melandrium terminale is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
